title: Where and How to Get Free Remote Raid Passes

steps.title: Rewarded by Research Breakthroughs.
steps.content: Rewarded by Research Breakthroughs. Earn a Research Breakthrough by completing 7 days of Field Research tasks, which you can find in the bottom right corner of your screen when you're looking at Pokémon Go on your smartphone. Remote Raid Passes aren't guaranteed as they are only a possible reward. If you have 3 or more Remote Raid Passes in your bag, you won't be able to get more.

steps.title: Buy 1 for 195 PokéCoins or buy 3 for 525 PokéCoins.
steps.content: Buy 1 for 195 PokéCoins or buy 3 for 525 PokéCoins. There used to be bundles available in the shop, but they have disappeared and have yet to appear again since May 2022. Although you can refill your supply of PokeCoins with real money, you can also earn them for free by leaving one of your Pokémon to defend a gym. Every hour they defend the gym earns you a set amount of PokéCoins. If your Pokémon stays in that gym for 8 hours and 30 minutes, you'll get 50 PokéCoins for free. If you have 3 or more Remote Raid Passes in your bag, you won't be able to get more.

steps.title: Open Pokémon Go.
steps.content: Open Pokémon Go. Tap the app icon that looks like a Poké Ball.

steps.title: Tap the silhouette Pokémon.
steps.content: Tap the silhouette Pokémon. It's below the binoculars icon in the lower bottom right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Select the Raid tab.
steps.content: Select the Raid tab. You'll see it to the right of Pokémon .

steps.title: Tap View for the raid you'd like to join.
steps.content: Tap View for the raid you'd like to join. The gyms with ongoing raids are displayed on that tab with their status (like "Ongoing" if a Raid is in progress). You can also skip this step and simply tap on a nearby gym from the map view. You can also use an invitation from a friend who's at the raid. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the pink Battle using a Remote Raid Pass button.
steps.content: Tap the pink Battle using a Remote Raid Pass button. Only 5 people can be in a lobby together who are raiding remotely, so if there are already 5 remote raiders there, you'll be added to a new lobby. Raid mechanics are the same for those who joined with a Remote Battle Pass and those who are physically at the Gym. However, attack power is decreased for Pokémon Trainers who join remotely versus the in-person Trainers. [2] X Research source You can only participate in a Remote Raid 5 times per day.
